intro: Ipsea speciosa, commonly known as the showy ipsea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Ipsea speciosa thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
